return.p: Returns true if the value is not a number, otherwise false.

example.heading: isFinite example
example.code:
console.log(Number.isFinite(NaN)); // false console.log(Number.isFinite("string")); // false console.log(Number.isFinite("12")); // true console.log(Number.isFinite(12)); // true console.log(Number.isFinite(12.42)); // true
console.log(Number.isFinite("")); // true console.log(Number.isFinite("\n\t")); // true console.log(Number.isFinite(null)); // true console.log(Number.isFinite(true)); // true
console.log(Number.isFinite(undefined)); // false
console.log(Number.isFinite(Infinity)); // false
